sources.data_found: Graduate program overview: Mentions the scale of the graduate program (MS and PhD).

student_data.notes: Exact enrollment headcounts by major are not published on the Brandeis registrar site. Counts are calculated based on the most recent verified 'Degrees Awarded' data (2022) from DataUSA (IPEDS). Undergrad Estimate: 153 CS Bachelor's degrees awarded × 4 years = 612 majors. Graduate (MS) Estimate: 106 CS Master's degrees awarded × 1.5 years (typical duration) = 159 students. PhD Estimate: 4 CS Research Doctorates awarded × 6 years (typical duration) = 24 students. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

gpu_resources.notes:
Data derived from Binah Cluster hardware specifications. 
1) A100 Count: 2 nodes (gpu-1-0, gpu-1-1) × 8 GPUs/node = 16 A100 GPUs. (Model assumed 40GB based on standard academic deployments of that cluster generation; specs do not explicitly specify 80GB).
2) V100 Count: 2 nodes (gpu-0-0, gpu-0-1) × 2 GPUs/node = 4 V100 GPUs. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: Brandeis has a relatively small but defined HPCC resource ('Binah'). Student numbers are estimated from graduation rates as real-time enrollment dashboards are not public.
